instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .
definitions.SMC_LID_R: What is SMC_LID_R? SMC_LID_R is the signal coming from the hall sensor that detects whether the laptop screen is closed or open. This must be high in order for SMC_LID to be high. SMC_LID has to be high for the machine to not fall asleep and for it to have a backlight..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
hello,

so first the macbook didnt have backlight, i have replaced the fuse and LCD connector because they were corroded, now the screen works perfectly,

but the problem is that the keyboard and touchpad are not working only the power button is working i can turn the macbook on and off,

i dont see any other corrosions on the board.
its an macbook pro 15'' early 2013

can anyone help please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: it does work with external keyboard and mouse via USB

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R5701</RESISTOR>/2/4.
Be sure <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> is correctly powered up.
Post <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> signal level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5702</RESISTOR> - (pin1   0V )  (pin2    0v)

<RESISTOR>R5701</RESISTOR> (pin1   2.76V) (pin2   2.76V)

<SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL>  0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
"Be sure <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> is correctly powered up."
???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: how can i check it?? i have checked all the solder joints and it looks all good no corrosion

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
Do you get VDD at <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>?

Inspect <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> area too.
Bluetooth works?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
wifi bluetooth and all usb ports are working
i get 3.03V VDD at <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> i have measured it on <CAPACITOR>C5701</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5706</CAPACITOR>..shouldnt this be 3.3V?
  and everything around <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> looks perfect no sign of damage..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: Change <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> then...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
i have replaced <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> and now i do have 3.3V VDD on  <CAPACITOR>C5701</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5706</CAPACITOR>..
the keyboard backlight is working now but the keyboard itself and trackpad dont.
do i still need to replace <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> if i have 3.3V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: Yes, try another <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, from donor board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: I will need to order it because i dont have it, ill post when i got it. Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: Buy scrap board, do not use new one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
yes i have ordered an donor board.

can SMC lid cause this problem aswell? because when i measure J5050 pin 6 <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_R</SIGNAL> i get only 1.52V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> MUST stay at 3.3V and <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> at 0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
when i measure at  <RESISTOR>R5050</RESISTOR> i get 3.3V  <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> and  <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_R</SIGNAL> also 3.3V
but at J5050 i get 1.52V is it normal? or is this caused by <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
Not normal, unless <RESISTOR>R5050</RESISTOR> is bad; incorrect value, too high.
Solder correct resistor and check if <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> works properly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: i have replaced the <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> it worked for 1 minute and now its not working again, when the macbook is booting i can press the caps lock and the led goes on and off but once its booted the led stays on or off and TP and KB are not working

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: i have tried few more times and the KB and TP are working sometimes 1-2 mins then it stops

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message:
Be sure <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> is correctly soldered; try another chip also.

Check <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> area too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2013 no keyboard and trackpad only power button
threads.message: the problem is solved by replacing the  <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, thanks!
